alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 4:33PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL AND NORTHEASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 432 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Variadero, or 21 miles north of Santa Rosa, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Newkirk. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 298 and 304. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 58 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
